description: VSequence identifier used in fasta file. This is used to create the fasta file for Genbank or GISAID by updating the sequence name in your fasta file to reflect the sample name for the specified database.
Identifier name for sample segment used for GISAID. Max length is 50 characters.
Identifier name for sample used for GISAID. Max length is 50 characters.
"Original" if the sample was sequenced directly from swabs, otherwise add the name of the cell line (e.g., "Vero") used to culture the specimen.
Local region name, county, territory, etc.
Additional location information (e.g. Cruise Ship, Convention, Live animal market).
Host species name. For Wastewater use "Environment".
Additional information regarding patient (e.g. Patient infected while interacting with animal).
Sampling strategy for sequence. (i.e. Baseline surveillance)
Sequencing purpose for sample. (i.e. DNA amplification)
Add the sequencer brand and model (e.g. Illumina MiSeq, Sanger, Nanopore MinION).
Additional information regarding patient (e.g. Patient infected while interacting with animal).
Unit of time for host age (e.g. Year is "Y", Month is "M").
